quote_last: , the restaurant was still about two hours from opening, which was how Randy liked it for their visits. As they passed by the wooden benches and coat racks in the lobby, Eva liked to stop and look at a sepia-toned portrait of the owners, Jack Dougherty and Ishmael Mendoza, and a framed “Story of Lulu’s” that was meant to help pass the time for customers willing to tolerate a substantial wait.
title: Kitchens of the Great Midwest
author: J. Ryan Stradal

quote_first: This time it was only the simple fact that the hands chanced to point to
quote_last: , the precise moment at which all the clocks of London had stopped.
title: The Purple Cloud
author: M.P. Shiel
